column4: hello there. I am in approximately hour 4 of the great windows -> ubuntu shift. but i think i have managed to destroy synaptic package manager
how did you do that?
no idea, but it gives me erros everytime i try to use it,so io cant actualy use it to get software
what errors?
did you change /etc/apt/sources.list at all?
i have no idea what that means. so its possible
what have you done so far to install things?
pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list please.
that might be it. Did you make a backup of your sources list?
do alt-f2, then "gedit /etc/apt/sources.list"
yep.
how far did you get in the beryl installation? Did you install any packages yet?
nope, it kept saying bash: /etc/apt/sources.list: Permission denied
i followed the installing beryl install guide as best i could. but becasue i have a geforce 4  i could use the autop script so had to try and understand what it was asking me to do.
remove the last bit from that file (the nVidia bit.) To edit the file, you need to do this: alt-f2, then gksudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list
this linux terminal thing is all new and slightly confusing
that's not the terminal I'm telling you to use.
I have to go now, sorry...
your a legend. it's people like you that make the shift easy
after you remove the nvidia bit, do the command "sudo aptitude update" and try again.
cool
thanks so much
no problem. I expect in a few months you'll be good enough at this to help out here.
